subject: Real Estate
title: Levittown and Mass-Produced Housing
description: A quick, practical guide to Levittown and Mass-Produced Housing.

hook.text: In 1947, Bill Levitt built 17,447 identical houses on Long Island and sold them for $7,990 each.

buildup.text: He applied assembly-line methods to construction. Each crew did one task, then moved to the next house.

discovery.text: A new home was completed every 16 minutes. Veterans could buy with no down payment using GI Bill loans.

twist.text: Levittown's contracts explicitly banned Black buyers. The American Dream had a racial clause.

climax.text: Mass-produced suburbs reshaped America but baked segregation into the foundation of homeownership.

punchline.text: The first suburb was built fast and sold unfairly.

quiz.question: How fast could Levittown builders complete a new house?
